summary: Success Test Series Hub — an exam preparation web app for UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, and State Exams. Includes free/paid test series, AI-powered question generator, top rankers leaderboard, exam categories, and a contact form. Has a login system and admin panel. Now adding: homepage image slider with admin management, OTP-based mobile login replacing password login, student profile with photo upload, daily current affairs and newspaper sections, bilingual (Hindi/English) tests with negative marking, bank payment details display, and enhanced admin panel with slider/current affairs/newspaper management.
architectural_notes: Backend API endpoints expected: GET /tests (returns test list) and POST /ai/generate (returns AI-generated questions)
Admin panel requires authentication — implement login with role-based access (admin vs. regular user)
Student login requires separate auth flow from admin — consider separate student session tokens and a student registration/login backend function
Current Affairs tests should include an explanation field per question — update the question schema to support optional explanation text

Bilingual support required: all test questions, options, explanations, and UI text must support both Hindi and English. Consider a language toggle in the header and storing question content in both languages in the backend schema.
Payment gateway integration planned — Razorpay or UPI gateway; each test will have a price field; students must pay before unlocking non-free tests
OTP login replaces password login for students — backend must support mobile number storage and OTP generation/validation (simulated since external SMS APIs unavailable)
Image slider data (poster URLs) should be stored in the backend actor and manageable via admin CRUD; frontend fetches and displays them dynamically

existing_features.title: Build the full React frontend for Success Test Series Hub. Implement a sticky header with the uploaded logo (frontend/public/assets/generated/logo.dim_256x256.png) and app name, a navigation bar with anchor links to: Home, Exam Categories, Free Tests, Paid Tests, Top Rankers, and Contact sections. Include a footer with copyright '© 2026 Success Test Series Hub | Privacy Policy | Terms & Conditions'.

Implement a Hero section with the headline 'Start Free Test Now!', a subheadline 'Practice for UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, and State Exams', and a prominent 'Start Free Test' button that scrolls to the Free Tests section and triggers loading of available tests.

Implement an Exam Categories section displaying five category cards: UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, and State Exams. Each card is clickable and filters the free tests list to show only tests in that category.

Implement a Free Tests section that fetches tests from the backend using getTests() and displays each test as a card with its title, category badge, and an 'Attempt' button. When 'Attempt' is clicked, show a modal or inline test-taking interface that renders all questions with radio button answer options. After submission, show the user's score and correct answers.

Implement a Paid Test Series section with three plan cards: Basic (₹49), Standard (₹99), and Premium (₹199). Each card should list 2–3 bullet-point features appropriate to the plan tier. The 'Buy Now' button on each card should display an informational modal indicating that payment processing will be available soon.

Implement a 'Why Choose Us' section with four feature highlights: AI-Generated Questions, Adaptive Tests, Live Proctoring, and Detailed Analytics. Each highlight should have an icon, a short title, and a one-sentence description.

Implement a Top Rankers section that fetches leaderboard data from the backend using getTopRankers() and displays a ranked table or card list showing each ranker's rank, name, exam category, and score. Highlight the top 3 with gold, silver, and bronze styling.

Implement an AI-Powered Test Generator section with a textarea for entering a topic or passage, a difficulty level selector (Easy, Medium, Hard), and a 'Generate Questions' button. On click, call the backend generateQuestions() function and display the returned questions as formatted cards showing question text, multiple-choice options, and the correct answer.

Implement a Contact section with a form containing Name, Email, and Message fields. On submit, call the backend submitContact() function with the form data. Show a success confirmation message upon completion and reset the form.

Apply a cohesive dark navy and gold visual theme throughout the app, consistent with the uploaded logo's color palette (deep navy blue, bright sky-blue accent, gold). Use bold typography for headings, card-based layouts with subtle shadows, and a dark header/footer. Apply green for primary CTA buttons (matching the original design intent) and gold accents for rankings and highlights.

Create a standalone Admin Login page at route /admin. Render a centered login card with Username and Password fields and a 'Login' button. On submit, call the backend login() function. On success, store the session token in React state (or localStorage) and redirect to the Admin Dashboard. On failure, display an inline error message 'Invalid credentials'. Style the page to match the existing dark navy and gold theme.

Create an Admin Dashboard page at route /admin/dashboard, accessible only when a valid session token exists (redirect to /admin if not authenticated). Render a sidebar with navigation links: Tests, Rankers, Contact Submissions, and a Logout button. Logout calls the backend logout() function, clears the session token, and redirects to /admin.

Implement the Tests management panel in the Admin Dashboard. Display a table of all existing tests showing id, title, and category. Include an 'Add Test' button that opens a modal form with fields: Title, Category (dropdown: UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, State Exams), and a dynamic questions editor (add/remove questions, each with question text, four options, and correct answer selector). Include Edit and Delete actions per row. On save, call addTest() or updateTest(); on delete, call deleteTest(). Refresh the list after each mutation.

Implement the Rankers management panel in the Admin Dashboard. Display a ranked table of all rankers showing rank, studentName, examCategory, and score. Include an 'Add Ranker' button that opens a modal form with fields: Student Name, Exam Category (dropdown), and Score. Include a Delete action per row. On save, call addRanker(); on delete, call deleteRanker(). Refresh the leaderboard after each mutation.

Implement the Contact Submissions panel in the Admin Dashboard. Display a table of all contact form submissions showing name, email, message, and timestamp. Call getContactSubmissions() using the active session token to fetch data. Show a loading state while fetching. The table should be read-only (no edit or delete actions required).

Create a Student Login / Register page at route /student/login. Render a centered card with tabs or toggle to switch between 'Login' and 'Register' modes. Login form has Username and Password fields; on submit call studentLogin() backend function, store the returned student session token in localStorage, and redirect to /student/dashboard. Register form has Username, Email, and Password fields; on submit call registerStudent(), store the returned token, and redirect to /student/dashboard. Show inline error messages on failure. Style the page to match the existing dark navy and gold theme.

Create a Student Dashboard page at route /student/dashboard, accessible only when a valid student session token exists in localStorage (redirect to /student/login if not). Display a welcome message with the student's username. Include a Logout button that calls studentLogout() on the backend, clears the student session token from localStorage, and redirects to /student/login. Add a 'Student Login' navigation link in the public-facing Header that navigates to /student/login. Style consistently with the existing dark navy and gold theme.

Update the Free Tests section on the frontend to support the new 'Current Affairs' category. Add 'Current Affairs' as a filter option in the Exam Categories filter UI so users can filter to see only Current Affairs tests. Ensure the category badge displayed on each test card correctly shows 'Current Affairs'.

Update the TestTakingModal to display the explanation for each question in the post-submission review screen. After the user submits a test, show the explanation text below the correct answer for every question so students understand why each answer is correct.

Add a language medium toggle to the app UI (accessible from the Header and persisted in localStorage) that allows users to switch between 'English Medium' and 'Hindi Medium'. The selected language must be stored in a React context so all components can read and react to it.

Update all public-facing UI labels, section headings, navigation links, button text, form placeholders, and static descriptive copy to render in Hindi when Hindi medium is selected and in English when English medium is selected. This covers: Header navigation links, Hero section headline and subheadline, Exam Categories section title and category names, Free Tests section headings and 'Attempt' button label, Paid Test Series plan names and feature bullets, Why Choose Us section title and feature card text, Top Rankers section heading and table column labels, AI Test Generator section labels and difficulty options, Contact form labels and placeholder text, and Footer copyright and policy links.

Update the TestTakingModal and the Free Tests test-taking interface to display question text, answer options, and post-submission explanations in the currently selected language medium. When Hindi medium is active, show questionHi, optionsHi, and explanationHi (if available); fall back to English fields if the Hindi fields are empty or absent.

Update the Admin TestFormModal to include Hindi-language input fields for each question: a 'Question (Hindi)' textarea, four 'Option (Hindi)' inputs, and an 'Explanation (Hindi)' textarea. These fields are optional but must be saved alongside the English fields when addTest() or updateTest() is called.

Update the Admin TestFormModal (frontend/src/components/TestFormModal.tsx) to include a 'Price (₹)' numeric input field at the top of the form (alongside Title and Category). The field must accept non-negative integers, default to 0 for free tests, and pass the price value when calling addTest() or updateTest() via the existing mutation hooks.

Display the price on each test card in the Free Tests section (frontend/src/components/FreeTests.tsx). If a test has price > 0, show a price badge (e.g., '₹49') and change the 'Attempt' button to a 'Buy to Unlock' button that opens an informational modal stating payment integration is coming soon. If price is 0, keep the existing 'Attempt' / free flow unchanged.

Restore the vibrant, colorful visual theme across the entire frontend to match the original design. Re-apply the deep navy blue background, bright sky-blue accents, gold highlights, and green primary CTA buttons as defined in frontend/src/index.css and frontend/tailwind.config.js. Ensure section backgrounds, card gradients, badges, and typography use the full color palette (navy, sky, gold, green) without being muted or desaturated. Confirm the Header, Footer, Hero, category cards, test cards, plan cards, rankers table, and AI generator section all display with vivid, saturated colors consistent with earlier versions.

Add a homepage image slider (poster carousel) below the header/hero on the public-facing site. Display uploaded poster images as full-width slides with Prev/Next navigation controls and auto-advance. If no posters are uploaded yet, show a placeholder banner. Backend must store slider images as records with an id, imageUrl (Text), and title (optional Text). Expose getSliders() query and addSlider(token, imageUrl, title) / deleteSlider(token, id) admin-authenticated update functions.

Add a 'Manage Sliders' panel to the Admin Dashboard sidebar. The panel must display a list of current poster slides (thumbnail, title, delete button) and provide an 'Add Slider' form with a URL input and optional title field. On save, call addSlider(); on delete, call deleteSlider(). Refresh the list after each mutation.

Add a 'Daily Current Affairs' section on the homepage that fetches and displays current affairs entries (date + headline text) from the backend. Also add a 'Daily Newspaper' section that displays a list of newspaper entries (date + URL/link) from the backend. Backend must store current affairs entries with id, date (Text), and content (Text), and newspaper entries with id, date (Text), and link (Text). Expose getCurrentAffairs() and getNewspapers() query functions. Expose admin-authenticated addCurrentAffairs(token, date, content), deleteCurrentAffairs(token, id), addNewspaper(token, date, link), and deleteNewspaper(token, id) update functions.

Add a 'Manage Current Affairs' and a 'Manage Daily Newspaper' panel to the Admin Dashboard sidebar. Each panel must list existing entries with date/content and a delete button. Each panel must have an 'Add' form. For Current Affairs: date and content text fields. For Newspaper: date and URL/link fields. On save call the respective add function; on delete call the respective delete function. Refresh lists after each mutation.

Replace the existing username/password-based student login with a Mobile Number + OTP login system. On the /student/login page: show a mobile number input and a 'Send OTP' button. After the user submits their mobile number, call the backend requestOtp(mobileNumber) function which generates and stores a 6-digit OTP tied to the mobile number (simulated — no real SMS). Then show an OTP input field and 'Verify OTP' button. Calling verifyOtp(mobileNumber, otp) on the backend validates the OTP, creates or retrieves the student account by mobile number, and returns a session token and student display name. On success, store the token in localStorage and redirect to /student/dashboard. On failure, show an inline error. Remove the old registerStudent and studentLogin password-based backend functions (or keep them deprecated) and add requestOtp() and verifyOtp() functions.

Add a Student Profile section accessible from the Student Dashboard at /student/dashboard. The profile section must display the student's mobile number and a circular profile photo (or a placeholder avatar if none uploaded). Include an 'Upload Photo' button that allows the student to select an image file; store the photo as a base64-encoded Text in the backend against their student record. Expose getStudentProfile(token) query and updateStudentProfilePhoto(token, photoBase64) update function on the backend.

Add a 'Students' management panel to the Admin Dashboard. Display a table of all registered students showing their mobile number and profile photo (rendered as a small circular thumbnail if available, otherwise a placeholder). Expose a backend admin query getStudents(token) that returns all student records including mobile number and photoBase64. The table should be read-only (no edit or delete).

Add negative marking support to tests. Extend the backend Test record to include a negativeMarkValue field (Float, default 0.0). Update addTest(), updateTest(), getTests(), and getTestById() to accept and return this field. In the Admin TestFormModal, add a 'Negative Mark per Wrong Answer' input (e.g., -0.33, -0.25, 0). Display the negative marking value on each test card in the Free Tests section. In the TestTakingModal, calculate and display the final score applying negative marks for wrong answers.

Display bank payment details in the Paid Test Series section. Below the plan cards, add a clearly styled 'Payment Details' box showing: Account Number: 444418210022399, IFSC Code: BKID0004444, Account Holder Name: Sachin Kumar. Style the box to stand out (e.g., a gold-bordered card) and include a note instructing students to transfer the payment and contact the admin for activation.

new_feature_requests.summary: Header, navigation bar, and footer
Hero section with Start Free Test button that loads tests from /tests API
Exam categories section (UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, State Exams)
Free test series section dynamically loaded from /tests endpoint
Paid test plans (Basic ₹49, Standard ₹99, Premium ₹199) with Buy Now buttons
Why Choose Us section highlighting AI questions, adaptive tests, proctoring, analytics
Top Rankers leaderboard section
AI-powered test generator connecting to /ai/generate endpoint with topic input and difficulty level
Contact form with name, email, and message fields

Create a backend actor that stores and serves free test series data. Each test has an id, title, category (e.g., UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, State Exams), and a list of questions (each with question text, options array, and correct answer). Seed the actor with at least 10 sample tests across categories. Expose query functions: getTests() returning all tests, getTestById(id) returning a single test with questions.

Create a backend actor function that accepts a topic string and difficulty level (easy, medium, hard) and returns a set of generated multiple-choice questions based on the topic. Since external AI APIs are not available, implement a template-based question generator that produces contextually relevant MCQs using the topic text and applies difficulty-appropriate question framing. Return an array of question objects each with: type, question, options, and answer fields.

Create a backend actor that stores contact form submissions. Each submission has name, email, and message fields with a timestamp. Expose a submitContact(name, email, message) update function that saves the entry.

Create a backend actor that stores a top rankers leaderboard. Each ranker entry has rank, studentName, examCategory, and score. Seed with at least 10 sample rankers. Expose getTopRankers() returning the sorted leaderboard.
Login system and admin panel for managing tests, rankers, contact submissions, and site content

Add backend support for admin authentication. Store a hardcoded admin username and password hash in the actor. Expose a login(username, password) update function that returns a session token (a random text token) on success, or an error on failure. Expose a validateSession(token) query that returns true if the token is active. Expose a logout(token) update function that invalidates the session token.

Add backend admin CRUD functions for tests. Expose addTest(token, title, category, questions) update that creates a new test (validates admin session first), updateTest(token, id, title, category, questions) update that modifies an existing test, and deleteTest(token, id) update that removes a test. All functions must reject with an error if the session token is invalid.

Add backend admin functions for managing the top rankers leaderboard. Expose addRanker(token, studentName, examCategory, score) update and deleteRanker(token, rank) update. Re-sort and re-rank entries after each mutation. All functions must validate the admin session token and reject with an error if invalid.
Add a backend query function getContactSubmissions(token) that returns all stored contact form submissions. Must validate the admin session token and return an error if invalid.

Add client-side routing to the frontend application to support the /admin and /admin/dashboard routes. Use React Router. The existing single-page app layout (App.tsx) should continue to render at the root route /. The /admin route should render the Admin Login page and /admin/dashboard should render the Admin Dashboard. Do not alter the existing public-facing page sections.
Update backend admin credentials: set username to 'STSHubsachin' and password to 'success@#2003'

Update the hardcoded admin credentials in the backend actor (backend/main.mo). Set the admin username to 'STSHubsachin' and the admin password to 'success@#2003'. Ensure the login() function validates against these new credentials and returns a valid session token on success.
Add a student login option — allow students to register and log in with their own accounts to track progress, access paid tests, and view their test history.

Add backend support for student accounts. Store student records with fields: id, username, passwordHash, email, and registeredAt timestamp. Expose a registerStudent(username, email, password) update function that creates a new student account (reject if username or email already exists) and returns a session token on success. Expose a studentLogin(username, password) update function that validates credentials and returns a session token on success, or an error on failure. Expose a validateStudentSession(token) query that returns true if the student token is active. Expose a studentLogout(token) update function that invalidates the student session token.

Add monthly Current Affairs free tests from January 2025 to present. Each test should have MCQ questions with 4 options and an explanation for each answer. Tests should be organized month-by-month and added to the free tests section.

Add monthly Current Affairs tests to the backend for each month from January 2025 through the most recent available month (up to the current date). Each test must have: a title in the format 'Current Affairs – [Month] [Year]', category set to 'Current Affairs', and at least 10 MCQ questions per month. Each question must include: question text, exactly 4 answer options (A–D), the correct answer, and a plain-English explanation of why that answer is correct. Seed all these tests using the existing addTest-compatible data structure so they are returned by getTests().

Ensure the backend Question type includes an optional 'explanation' field (Text). Update addTest(), updateTest(), and the existing question record type in main.mo to carry this field. The getTests() and getTestById() responses must include the explanation field so the frontend can display it.

Add bilingual support (Hindi and English) throughout the app. Add a language toggle/selector so users can switch between Hindi medium and English medium. All content including questions, options, explanations, and UI labels should be available in both languages.

Extend the backend Question record type to include optional Hindi-language fields: questionHi (Text), optionsHi ([Text]), and explanationHi (?Text). Update addTest(), updateTest(), getTests(), and getTestById() to carry these new fields so the frontend can access Hindi content alongside English content.

Seed the existing Current Affairs monthly tests (January 2025 onwards) in the backend with Hindi translations for each question — questionHi, optionsHi, and explanationHi — so that Hindi medium users see fully translated Current Affairs test content.
Integrate a payment gateway (Razorpay or UPI) so students can pay and unlock paid/premium tests instantly. Replace the placeholder buyPlan() alert with real payment flow.
Add a 'Price' field for each test in the Admin panel (TestFormModal). Allow admin to set a price (₹) per test. Free tests can have price 0. Update backend test record to include a price field.
Restore the original colorful visual theme as it was before — ensure the app looks vibrant and colorful as in earlier versions.

Extend the backend Test record type in backend/main.mo to include a 'price' field (Nat, defaulting to 0 for free tests). Update addTest(), updateTest(), getTests(), and getTestById() to accept and return this price field. Existing tests without a price should default to 0.
Add a homepage image slider (poster carousel) with prev/next controls. Add a 'Manage Sliders' section in the admin panel to upload and delete poster images.
Replace password-based student login with Mobile Number + OTP login system. Students enter their mobile number, receive an OTP, and verify it to log in.
Add a Student Profile section where students can view their details and upload a profile photo. Admin panel should display student profile photos and mobile numbers.
Add a 'Daily Current Affairs' box and a 'Daily Newspaper' section (for PDF/link uploads) on the homepage. Admin panel should have 'Manage Current Affairs' and 'Daily Newspaper' management options.

Add negative marking support to tests. Each test should have a configurable negative mark value per wrong answer (e.g., -0.33 or -0.25). Display negative marking info on test cards and during the test.
Display bank payment details (A/C: 444418210022399, IFSC: BKID0004444, Name: Sachin Kumar) in the paid tests/payment section of the website so students know how to pay.
